meanings.definition: To establish a colony in (a place).
meanings.sent1: The explorers decided to colonise the new land and build a settlement.
meanings.sent2: Many years ago, people would colonise new territories to expand their empires.
meanings.sent3: The ants seemed to colonise the picnic area, claiming it as their own territory.
meanings.sent4: The vines began to colonise the garden, spreading and taking over the flower beds.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria started to colonise the petri dish, multiplying rapidly.

meanings.definition: To settle in (an area) and take control of its government.
meanings.sent1: The conquerors planned to colonise the island and establish their rule.
meanings.sent2: During the Age of Exploration, European powers sought to colonise distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to colonise the playground, declaring themselves as kings and queens.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species began to colonise the ecosystem, disrupting the natural balance.
meanings.sent5: The virus started to colonise the host's body, causing illness and spreading infection.
